Dialogue: Sara.   You'll get in.

Dialogue: Don't lie because you love me.     My free form sucks.

Dialogue: For luck tomorrow. Not that you'll need it. You dance like an angel.

Dialogue: 'Awesome, Father, S.J. auditions today. She's ready for them. Please make them ready for her. Even if she screws up. Thanks. Amen.'  God's gotten me outta all kinds of shit. He oughta be able to get you into Juilliard.

Dialogue: Ellison -- Mr. Ellison. He actually told me to break a leg.

Dialogue: Ruin everyone's Valentine's Day and not have a shop when I get back. That's your definition of great? I can see the headline now: 'Starving Artist Kills Unfit Mother.'  Sweetheart, we talked about this. I'll get there as soon as I can.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Right. This is the hardest, most important day of my life and all you can do is get there as soon as you can. Thanks, Mom.

Dialogue: I won't miss your audition, Sara. I'll be there, okay? If I have to swim the Susquehanna, I'll be there.

Dialogue: I'll float then.

Dialogue: Guess you got stuff.    Baggage.

Dialogue: I'm kinda tired.

Dialogue: I didn't like leavin' you so soon after the funeral. I wouldn't have if you hadn't asked me to go. I mean, I could've hung around. Helped you say good-bye. That's what you were doin', wasn't it?

Dialogue: Uh-huh.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: That's what I figured you were doin'.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Look. Sara. I feel bad too. I mean, we both got hit by the same bolt of lightning. You don't have to pretend this is easy.  Everything's upside down right now but don't worry. Dialogue: Thought you were moving to Fells Point.

Dialogue: Fell through.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Not much of what you're used to. But the water's hot and the fridge is full. And I made room in the closets for you. Girl's gotta have closets, right? You even get your own bed. I'll crash on the couch.

Dialogue: You bought a bed?

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Pardon me. Your own futon.     Check it out. On the other side.

Speaker: roy

Speaker: sara

Dialogue: Are you alright, Sara?  I just wanna know how you feel.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I feel fine.     I feel like calling Lindsay.

Speaker: roy

Speaker: roy

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: -- Pick you up. Three-thirty.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yeah.   Sure. Whatever.

Dialogue: ... It's no fun being uprooted in the middle of your senior year. We realize that and we'll do what we can to help with the transition.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: About school?     No.   Not really.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm not gonna be here that long. Besides, it's just a city, right?

Speaker: sara's pov
Dialogue: as she MOVES FORWARD. A crush of KIDS -- mostly black with a sprinkling of white and Latino faces thrown in. Kids like her. Only they don't dress like her. They dress like commercials for Tommy Hilfiger and Calvin Klein. And they definitely don't sound like her...  TEENAGER #1 Yo, man, check it, the muthafuckers wasn't playin', they was jackin'. Ten rides in five days. For real.  TEENAGER #2 Fools got caught for real too. Ten years in five days. Stall that shit!  Sara walks on, taking this netherworld in, eavesdropping on other conversations. It's not just the words. It's how they say them: Loud. Matter-of-fact. Cool. A cooler cool. Like they breathe static electricity.    16.  40   CONTINUED:                                                      40  That's it! The entire student body is energized. Sara's thoughts are jolted by two black girls squeezing by. One clips Sara's elbow as she passes, knocking it against a locker. They keep going as if they don't see her. No one seems to see her. Welcome to mass avoidance at Patterson High.

Dialogue: Ain't no need in fuckin' me... stuck up, bitch... I'm on your side

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: Yo. Me and the boyz fixin' to shoot some hoops. Us against Druid Hill. If you interested.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Druid Hill?   Hell yeah.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: Gotta skip last period.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I got study hall. Don't matter anyway. Not with those suckers. I'll be back before the bell rings.

Speaker: female voice
Dialogue: Don't start nothin', won't be nothin'! Stay down, girl!

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: It ain't over, bitch.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Over? I don't even know why it started... bitch. And don't say it's about Patrick because it's not. It's not about him.

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: No. It's about you. White girls like you. Creepin' up, takin' our men. The whole world ain't enough. You gotta conquer ours too.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I like him, he likes me. And if you don't like that, screw you.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: What the hell happened to you?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I got suspended. Two days.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: For what? Fighting?  Why were you fighting, Sara?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm not sure. I think it's some kind of black female thing.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: How's Arvel?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Pretty bad.  Can't even play a got-damned game of ball no more.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: You see Sara? She alright?  You didn't hear? Nikki jumped off at her in gym. It was fierce...

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's alright.    I'm okay.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Look.  It's not a good time.  I'll see you later... I'm okay.

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: Diondre, what your butt doin' here?

Speaker: diondre
Dialogue: I can go where I want. You the one on punishment.

Speaker: diondre
Dialogue: There she go.    Gimme my two dollars.

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: Whatever it is, I don't wanna hear it.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I thought you had somethin' to say to me.

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: You thought wrong.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Somethin' must be on your mind for you to get up in Sara's face, start all this drama. What you tryin' to prove, Nikki?

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: You're the one tryin' to prove something. Stuck up in her shit like she's somethin' special.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: What if she is? What's it to you? You didn't see me trippin' off that Howard dude and I could have. I coulda tripped hard, Nikki.

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: That was different.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: How you gonna call it different?

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: Because she's white and he ain't. And don't sit there like you don't know what I'm talkin' about, Patrick.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: You don't even know what you're talkin' about, Nikki.

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: I don't?     Y'all black men, soon as you even    think about goin' someplace    good, first thing you do is find a    white girl to take with you.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I thought I was goin' someplace good with you. You the one called me off. But you ain't tryin' to remember that. Now you mad. Why? Because she's white and I like her? I'm with her.

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: Please. You're with her because she's white. That's what sets me off.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: It ain't got no business settin' you off! Me and her ain't got nothin' to do with you and what you think. So keep your hands off her and that shit to yourself.

Speaker: nikki
Dialogue: I don't think it, I know it. But you go ahead, deny it. That's what y'all always do.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: What? I'm supposed to get excited because you decided to skate by and drop a dollar on the dresser?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: It's more than a dollar. And it's all I got.  I got laid off rom B.W.I., Chenille. I been workin' part- time. Money's tight. You know how you are about money. That's way I haven't been coming around.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: Money ain't got nothin' to do with it, Kenny. You don't come around because you don't feel like comin' around. You don't want the responsibility of comin' around. As long as you out there and I'm in here, you know your son's being taken care of. You ain't got no worries when it comes to him.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: And you don't have no   feelings when it comes to me.    All you do is bitch and complain   about what I don't do. I get sick    of that.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: Be sick of it. You ain't got to see me to see your son.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: I'll be sure to keep that in mind.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Want me to take him?

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: That wench. You gotta stand over her to make sure she puts your name on the damn list. Triflin' bitch.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'll get 'em.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: So your old man flipped about the fight.  Probably thinks it's all Patrick's fault.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No.   I explained about Nikki.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: Right. You put it all on her. None of it's on you.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: She started it, Chenille. She wanted to start it. I told you what she said.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: Maybe she didn't have no business gettin' in your face. But she had a reason to say what she said.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: So you agree with her? You think I don't belong with Patrick.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: What I think don't matter. But you and him act like it don't bother people that you're together. Like it don't hurt people to see.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: We like each other. What is the big fucking deal? It's him and me. Not us and other 'people.'

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: Black people, Sara. Black women.  Patrick's about somethin'. He's smart. He's motivated. He's for real. He ain't gonna make no babies and not take care of 'em or run the streets, fuck up his life. He's gonna do somethin' with himself. Here you come, white and right, and you take one of the few decent men left after jail, drugs and drive-bys. That's what Nikki meant about you up in our world.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: There's only one world, Chenille.  I thought we were friends. Guess I was wrong.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: So what you gonna do?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: How many times you gonna ask me that?

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: It's payback time. Either you down or you ain't. Either you m'boy or you not. Simple as that.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Even if I did ride, you ain't got nobody but Lip and Lip will get a nigger's ass killed. Quick.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: Eastside ain't got no firepower. I got some shit, man. AK-47. We go in, get out with one spray down.

Speaker: snookie
Dialogue: You see us, Patrick?

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: You see us, man? We're rappin'.

Speaker: snookie
Dialogue: Me and Sara lit it up!      Y-e-o-w!

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: That shit ain't funny.

Speaker: snookie
Dialogue: Damn right it ain't funny.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: I thought you liked it down there. That's your specialty, ain't it? Crawling?

Speaker: snookie
Dialogue: That was a reflex action, man. And you just plain rude and wrong to bring the shit up in mixed company.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I gotta get home. Ready?

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: No, he ain't ready. He's talkin'. To me. A-B conversation. Gotta go? C yourself the fuck home.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Fuck you.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Have you lost your motherfuckin' MIND, man? Huh? Have you!

Speaker: snookie
Dialogue: Patrick, man, c'mon.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: You take that bitch's back and won't even cover mine?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: 'Cause you wrong, Malakai!

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: No! You wrong. You BEEN wrong. You ain't worth shit no more.  Get out my face, and take that ho with you.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: We should keep going.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: You messed up.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I know I messed up. I'll get it right the next time.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: No. You gonna get it right now so you can do it perfect next time.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I can't work like this.      I can't dance like this.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Like what?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Like this.     You dictating to me.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: What's wrong, Sara?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Nothing's wrong.  I can't figure things out.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: What things? The audition? You ain't got nothin' to worry about. I told you. I'll be there.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Things, Patrick. Things between us. Things between us and them.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I didn't know there was a 'them.'

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Well, open your pretty brown eyes, look the hell around.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: They only got a point if you believe they got a point, Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm just saying that we should think about this, that's all.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: That's a fuckin' 'nough.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Why are you getting mad?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Because I like to think for myself, run my own life, and I thought you did too.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You're never gonna run your own life as long as you keep running back to Malakai every time he fucks up or fucks you over.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: First of all, Malakai ain't never fucked me over. Second of all, you don't know him, Sara, what he been through. Matter of fact, you don't know shit about none of it. So don't come off to me like you do.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I know he's lost, Patrick! Everybody but you can see that. And if you keep reaching back for him, you're gonna wind up lost too.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Who the fuck are you to say he's lost? Malakai had my back when you were busy gee-whizzin' in the woods with your backward-ass, redneck friends.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: They weren't rednecks!

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: You know what?     The hell with you.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: The hell with you too!

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Thought you might need this on Saturday. I ain't gonna be able to make it.

Speaker: toni
Dialogue: Lovers' quarrel? You're better off. That menace to society would've broken your heart and spent all your money in a news flash. Trust me on that, Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Toni, listen carefully. You're a simple bitch and you don't have any friends, black or white, because nobody likes a fucking asshole.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: I was wondering... how long you plan on hating me? Maybe I'm an optimist but I hope there's some kind of timetable.  Well, I don't wanna bug you. I just came in to say good luck.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: I saw the return address. Got curious. It was open. I read it. I know I shouldn't have but at least now I have an excuse to tell you how proud I am of you, Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I was gonna tell you about the audition, Roy. I meant to.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Tomorrow's the big day?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Uh-huh.   The big day.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: You bummed out about it?  You're a worse liar than I am father.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You're not so bad.  I didn't give you much to work with. It's not like I've been the perfect daughter.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Well, it ain't like I deserve a perfect daughter. I screwed up. Did everything in a hurry and still thought I had all the time in the world. To be in love with your mother. Be a father to you. But time flies. You look up one day and all you got to show for yourself is a pretty little girl who hates your guts and won't talk to you because too much time went by.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I don't hate you. I miss her. I miss Mom...  ... Patrick's pissed at me. I'm pissed at him. He's not coming tomorrow and I want him there and I don't know what to do.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: You want him there. I understand that. But whatever he brings to the table, Patrick can't dance for you, Sara. You're the bottom line out there. This is your chance to be the dancer Juilliard came to see.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I wanted somebody there who loves me.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: I love you.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: Why his mom's cryin' like that? Arvel's gonna make it, right? That what's his nurse said. She told me herself, 'Your friend's gonna make it.' Did that bitch lie to me! Talk to me, Patrick! Is he gone?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: They just got bad news, man. They don't need to hear it again.  Arvel's fightin'. He's gonna pull through. Thing is, when he does, they don't think... he ain't... shit. Arvel ain't gonna walk again.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: I got a good reason now, man?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Malakai...  ... When it's on, I'll be there.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: Why you so quiet?  You know how I go off on folks sometimes. I mean it and then I don't mean it. Like what I said to Sara. Guess she told you.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I don't care what you said, Chenille.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: Patrick. Your ass is on your back and your lips are on the ground. You care, baby brother. And not just about what I said.  You seriously like Sara. She got a serious jones for you. Am I lyin'?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: It's besides the point. Whatever point it is you tryin' to make.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: I'm sayin' you can't help who you love, Patrick. At least you found somebody who loves you back.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I gotta go.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: To where? To who? Malakai?  You ain't through with that fool yet.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: He's not a fool, Chenille.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: No. You know what? You're the fool, Patrick. You think you let Malakai down and all you did was try to pull yourself up. Ain't no blame or shame in that.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I still gotta go. Check you later.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: It cut me, what you said.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: I shouldn't have... I was trippin'.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: You always trip. I'm used to that. Besides, you were right. You were wrong, too. So was I. I need to do better. Ain't no doubt about that.

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: I know I come down on you hard about money, but I would rather you spend the time. Seriously.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: So you don't want any money?

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: I didn't say all that.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: I love my son, Chenille.    You know that, don't you?

Speaker: chenille
Dialogue: Yeah.   I always knew that.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Pull over.  This ain't helpin' nobody, 'Kai. I'm out. I mean it. Stop the car.

Speaker: lip
Dialogue: Awww, shit.      Here we go.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: What you mean you out? You think I'ma let your punk ass bail on me again?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: What you gonna do, 'Kai? You gonna shoot me? Go ahead! You'll have to!

Speaker: lip
Dialogue: Let him out!   We don't need him.

Speaker: malakai
Dialogue: Shut the fuck up.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: finishes with a flawless arabesque.      Looks out.

Speaker: stern judge
Dialogue: You prepared a free-form?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yes... sir... they have... my music.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: Does it have a theme?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yes.  Emo...  Emotion.

Speaker: stern judge
Dialogue: Cue Johnson's music.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I wasn't ready.       Can you start it over again?

Speaker: stern judge
Dialogue: Are you ready now?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: You can do it.  Ain't nobody watchin' you but me.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm ready.

Speaker: stern judge
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, please!  Young man! Get off the stage.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: All due respect, if ya'll don't let this girl in, you're crazy!

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Thank you.   Very much.

Speaker: stern judge
Dialogue: Ms. Johnson!

Speaker: stern judge
Dialogue: I can't say this on the record -- yet. But welcome to Juilliard.
